intro: Chelonopsis odontochila subsp. rosea, commonly known as the rose-flowered chelonopsis, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often emitting a subtle scent when crushed. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
